cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ENE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast tonight, then turning northeast and skirting or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks Monday before accelerating northeastward off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks / Cape Hatteras area, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-central Florida northward along the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts, including North Carolina and southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 mph with isolated tropical-storm-force gusts possible Monday night into Tuesday as Arthur passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft above ground possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay and Virginia Beach during times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Generally 0.5–1 inch of rain with locally higher amounts possible in outer rain-bands Monday night–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents impacting port approaches and pilot boarding areas.
